title: RSA Breach: The Untold Story, Part 1
description: In the early 2000s, Nortel was consciously, intentionally, aggressively positioning itself as a partner and a friend of China. At the same time, it was China's number one target for corporate espionage - and an early victim of its new 'Unrestricted Warfare' doctrine.
content:encoded:
In March 2011, RSA was facing a terrible dilemma. An attacker siphoned data relating to SecureID, the company’s flagship product used by thousands of high-profile clients around the world – but it was unknown whether the attacker also stole the cryptographic key needed to decipher that data. Should the company disclose the breach, or keep it quiet in the hope that SecureID will remain safe?â€¦
A special collaboration with Wired magazine, exposing – for the first time – the untold story behind one of the most dramatic hacks of all time.
